body:
Thanks Andy! I recommend VLC player for all your codec brain damage issues. Seems to play everything (it's what I used to listen to the original files), it's free, and it was suggested to me by none other than John M from this very list.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/VLC_media_player

This is such a good bunch of peeps.

- Rob

Rob Guglielmetti
National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL)
Commercial Buildings Research Group
15013 Denver West Parkway MS:RSF202
Golden, CO 80401
303.275.4319
robert.guglielmetti at nrel.gov



On 9/19/12 11:07 AM, "Andrew McNeil" <amcneil at lbl.gov<mailto:amcneil at lbl.gov>> wrote:

Hi Everyone,

I've re-encoded all the audio files from the workshop because some people had problems listening to them on windows PCs.  The new files play using iTunes, quicktime or various other *good* media players on windows.  They still don't play with windows media explorer (unless you've managed to install the right codec).  I've also updated a few of the presentations over the last couple of days.

The trouble with posting materials quickly is that revisions become necessary...

Andy


On Mon, Sep 17, 2012 at 10:59 AM, Andrew McNeil <amcneil at lbl.gov<mailto:amcneil at lbl.gov>> wrote:
All,
I've just uploaded the last of the presentations, including replacing presentation that had pdf export artifacts.  Greg's photos have also been posted.  If anyone else has photos they'd like to share, send them to me and I can add them.

There are now zip files so you can download all the presentations at once.

Andy




On Sun, Sep 16, 2012 at 9:45 PM, Guglielmetti, Robert <Robert.Guglielmetti at nrel.gov<mailto:Robert.Guglielmetti at nrel.gov>> wrote:
Thanks to all for hosting this event, attending the event, and for sharing the event with those of us who were unable to attend. Very interesting presentations, and I have not yet seen/heard them all yet!

Next year at NREL? I guess I'll get started on that now. =)  (that would be awesome.)

- Rob
________________________________________
Sent: Friday, September 14, 2012 4:12 PM
To: Radiance general discussion
Presentations and Audio from the last day of the workshop have been posted:
http://www.radiance-online.org/community/workshops/2012-copenhagen

Thanks to Nicolas Roy, Velux, and the Royal Danish Academy for hosting the workshop.
Thanks to Greg for recording the audio.

I personally look forward to attending the next workshop (at NREL?).

Andy



On Thu, Sep 13, 2012 at 3:02 PM, Andrew McNeil <amcneil at lbl.gov<mailto:amcneil at lbl.gov><mailto:amcneil at lbl.gov<mailto:amcneil at lbl.gov>>> wrote:
Materials from the second day are now posted:
http://www.radiance-online.org/community/workshops/2012-copenhagen

Including slides for Greg's Wednesday Seminar.

Thanks Greg & Presenters!


On Thu, Sep 13, 2012 at 9:03 AM, Andrew McNeil <amcneil at lbl.gov<mailto:amcneil at lbl.gov><mailto:amcneil at lbl.gov<mailto:amcneil at lbl.gov>>> wrote:
All,

Slides and audio from most of the seminar presentations at the Radiance workshop on Wednesday are posted here:
https://www.radiance-online.org/community/workshops/2012-copenhagen

Enjoy!

Andy
